    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Thunder Sling](/Weapons.aspx?ID=480)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=526" />
<trait label="Propulsive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=677" />
<trait label="Tengu" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=776" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 274 <sup>1.1</sup>, [Ancestry Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=74) pg. 138 <sup>3.0</sup>, [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 31 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 5 gp

**Damage** 1d6 P

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

**Range** 50 ft.

**Reload** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Ranged

**Category** Martial

**Group** [Sling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=13)
</row>

</column>

---

Tengu use these specialized slings to fire darts further and with greater force than when thrown by hand. A thunder sling uses [darts](/Weapons.aspx?ID=426) as ammunition. It can also hurl [blowgun darts](/Weapons.aspx?ID=440) as ammunition but deals 1d4 piercing damage instead of 1d6 when used this way.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-13" />
